title: Samuel Goldwyn
summary: Samuel Goldwyn (born Szmuel Gelbfisz; Yiddish: שמואל געלבפֿיש‎;  August 27, 1882 –  January 31, 1974), also known as Samuel Goldfish,[1] was a Polish-American film producer. He was best known for being the founding contributor and executive of several motion picture studios in Hollywood.[2] His awards include the 1973 Golden Globe Cecil B. DeMille Award,[3] the Irving G. Thalberg Memorial Award in 1947, and the Jean Hersholt Humanitarian Award in 1958.
